channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Nvidia to report third-quarter earnings after the bell
item.description: In August, Nvidia said it expected about "several billion" in Blackwell sales during the January quarter.

item.title: Alphabet's VC arm backs little-known SAP rival Odoo, boosting valuation to $5.3 billion
item.description: Odoo, an enterprise software startup rivalling SAP, boosted its valuation to $5.3 billion in a secondary share round led by Alphabet's VC fund and Sequoia.

item.title: European Central Banks warns of trade tension risks to euro zone financial stability
item.description: The Financial Stability Review also said weak growth was now a bigger threat to the 20-nation euro zone than high inflation.

item.title: Comcast to spin off cable networks as subscribers flee the bundle
item.description: Comcast on Wednesday announced the spinoff of its cable networks, including CNBC, MSNBC and E!.

item.title: FTX co-founder Gary Wang avoids prison time for role in crypto fraud
item.description: Gary Wang was the fifth former FTX executive to be handed a punishment for his role in the collapse of the crypto exchange in late 2022.

item.title: U.S. closes embassy in Kyiv over potential 'significant' air attack as tensions with Russia soar
item.description: The U.S. has closed its embassy in Kyiv, warning that it has "received specific information of a potential significant air attack" on Wednesday.

item.title: Euro-dollar parity is back in focus as Trump win sparks trade jitters
item.description: The euro last traded at $1 and below in 2022, but fresh developments have put parity back on the agenda.

item.title: Thailand legalizing same-sex marriage is likely to bring a flood of tourists
item.description: Thailand's same-sex marriage law could add 4 million tourists and $2 billion in tourism revenue per year, according to a report commissioned by Agoda.

item.title: Rafael Nadal has made $134 million in career prize money, will retire as No. 2 highest-earning tennis player ever
item.description: The 38-year-old's career earnings are surpassed only by Novak Djokovic's.

item.title: What Trump's return to the White House could mean for global bond yields
item.description: It is thought that Trump's pledge to introduce tax cuts and steep tariffs could boost economic growth — but widen the fiscal deficit and refuel inflation.

item.title: UK inflation surges above Bank of England's 2% target, curbing December rate cut expectations
item.description: The hike marks a sharp increase from the 1.7% rise recorded in September and exceeds the 2.2% forecast of economists polled by Reuters.

item.title: Japan exports rise more than expected in October, rebounding from 43-month low
item.description: Japan's trade deficit expanded to 461.2 billion yen ($2.98 billion), compared to September's revised figure of 294.1 billion yen.

item.title: Delta expects higher profits thanks to high-end travel and 'resilient economy'
item.description: Delta, the most profitable U.S. airline, expects to expand capacity by no more than 4% year-over-year in 2025.

item.title: Target shares plunge 20% after discounter cuts forecast, posts biggest earnings miss in two years
item.description: Target missed on earnings and revenue even as it cut prices on thousands of items, including milk, diapers and toys, to try to attract discerning shoppers.

item.title: Jim Cramer wants to buy this falling tech stock — and touts another reason to like Disney
item.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

item.title: U.S. 'industrial renaissance' is fueling a rebound in fundraising, Apollo CEO Marc Rowan says
item.description: Capital raising activity is set for a rebound in the U.S. amid a global "industrial renaissance," Oaktree Capital Management Co-Chairman Howard Marks says.

item.title: China expectedly keeps benchmark lending rates steady as Beijing assesses stimulus measures
item.description: The People's Bank of China said it would keep the one-year loan prime rate at 3.1%, while holding the five-year LPR at 3.6%.

item.title: Seven & i shares surge on report its founding family is raising over $50 billion to take the firm private
item.description: NHK said the founding family will raise over 8 trillion yen from "three Japanese megabanks and major American financial institutions."

item.title: Trump tariffs to push down U.S. growth 'a great deal' going into 2026, Morgan Stanley warns
item.description: Donald Trump's proposed tariffs will dent U.S. economic growth going into 2026, said Morgan Stanley's chief global economist Seth Carpenter.

item.title: Qualcomm says it expects $4 billion in PC chip sales by 2029, as company gets traction beyond smartphones
item.description: Qualcomm said on Tuesday that it expects its push into new markets to generate an additional $22 billion per year by 2029.

item.title: Russia says Ukraine attacked it using U.S. long-range missiles, signals it's ready for nuclear response
item.description: Russia has signaled to the West it's ready for a nuclear confrontation.

item.title: SpaceX completes sixth Starship flight, splashes down both booster and spacecraft
item.description: SpaceX launched its sixth Starship test flight to date on Tuesday.

item.title: Market veteran Howard Marks cautions that China's economic growth target is a 'Herculean challenge'
item.description: Veteran investor Howard Marks is hopeful about China's economy, but cautions that the country's growth target is a monumental challenge.

item.title: Doubts mount over Britain’s ambitious growth plans — with warnings of further tax rises possible
item.description: Doubts are mounting over the Labour government's flagship growth and investment agenda, with one analyst warning further tax rises could be on the horizon.

item.title: Russia-U.S. tensions briefly hit global markets as Putin lowers the threshold for a nuclear strike
item.description: Stocks briefly fell and investors fled to safe haven assets on Tuesday, as global markets reacted to escalating tensions between the world's two largest nuclear powers.

item.title: Trump picks Dr. Oz to lead massive Medicare and Medicaid agency CMS
item.description: Dr. Mehmet Oz previously ran for a Senate seat from Pennsylvania. CMS is one of the biggest agencies in the U.S. government, overseeing Medicare and Medicaid.

item.title: A double whammy of tariffs and strikes is coming for U.S. trade and the global supply chain in early 2025
item.description: Shippers and logistics companies are gaming out a complex early 2025 as President-elect Donald Trump may hike tariffs, and East and Gulf Coast ports may strike.

item.title: Trump attends SpaceX Starship launch in Texas with CEO Elon Musk
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump attended a SpaceX launch in Texas with CEO Elon Musk, whom he tapped to oversee a government efficiency commission.

item.title: Bitcoin rises to a new record as investors absorb growing Ukraine-Russia tensions
item.description: Bitcoin moved higher Tuesday amid rising geopolitical tensions between Ukraine and Russia.

item.title: Walmart may have to raise some prices if Trump tariffs take effect, CFO says
item.description: The discounter's comments are the latest warning from retail leaders about the potential impact of the tariffs.
